intro: Silene tincta, commonly known as the redstem sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky habitats in North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color, with five petals that bloom in late spring to early summer. Silene tincta is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh climates.
